lexUnit.name: realize.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: become fully aware of as a fact; understand clearly.

sentence.text: To explain a watch we need to realize both how its springs and wheels ( or , nowadays , microchips ) work and that its purpose is to tell the time .
When Amelia had had her serve the drinks , Nina realised just how far gone she was .
But after only four miles he began to realize just how far he would have to walk .
She realised just how obvious it was that Hebden had some involvement with the murder .
He brought out the very worst in her , she realised numbly .
Shelley had n't realised the implications of visiting a hospital over eight miles away .
Yet both sections realised the futility of trying to be too independent .
By 10.00am we realize our mistake in not pressing on all night .
How stupid she 'd been not to realise it from the start .
It 's at this point nearing the end of my open study I 've realised a connection between the four characters I have just compared .
All that changed , however , when he realised a rich talent for spin bowling was in danger of going to waste .
In that instant she realised the whole shocking weirdness of what was going on .
It was then put about by the powers-that-be that , being new , they had not realised the significance of what they were doing .
For the first time I realized the humiliating narrowness of mind with which one has to be equipped in time of war .
The singer is expected to be able to realize and express the emotional and spiritual implications of what he is singing .
She telephoned the local press and said , ` Do you realize there 's a shop called The Body Shop opening next door to the undertaker 's ?
It must be realised that fractals are hierarchies with the particular property that the successive levels are geometrically similar ( either exactly or on the average ) .
It was soon realized by many of the middle class that ` time is money " and consequently must be carefully regulated and used economically .
Perhaps one day it will be realised by all that when Wales struggle every component of Welsh rugby is liable to struggle too .
One realises from studying the affairs surrounding the Maxwell Group that the Opposition know everything that there is to know about sleaze .
Now write as much as you can about Auntie the sort of person she was , what members of her family thought of her , what her niece realises about her at the end .
One thing I realised about my renewal of my faith is that I had nothing to do with it !
He realized from Carolyn 's face that it did .
She grasped the light covering and was about to throw it off when she realised from the fabric 's texture that her own cotton skirt had been laid over her .
She realised from the quizzical looks that met this further information that she had made matters worse rather than better .
The clerk , realising from Mirsal 's uniform that I belong to the sacred official class , merely bows his head to the storm , pays up and looks pleasant .
He began to realize from the nature of these sites how the leys could have been constructed .
Why had she never realised before this that Dana had every right to do as she pleased , regardless of how her sister felt ?
He nodded at her and Kate realised with growing dismay that the man was drunk .
He got half-way down the corridor and realized in irritation that he had no idea where she had been given an office .
` Oh , yes , I 've realised since that you were n't like the rest of us ordinary human beings who are unfortunate enough to be troubled by feelings like grief and guilt . "
To his horror he realised his hand was lying in the embers .
He realized Maisie was kissing him .
She did n't realise she was doing it .
But now she suddenly realised it fitted him like a glove .
And anyone who is brave enough to venture inside will realise how the time was spent .
Once you let up , you will give him time to think , and he 'll realise how much money you 've lost him .
" As soon as I had realized what he had said I returned home again immediately . "
He groaned when he realised how far away it was .
Do you realise how many brain cells you probably managed to kill off last night ? "
He immediately realized that this was a most unusual kind of cat and started a breeding programme .
I realize that my unconsidered remarks were dangerously indiscreet . "
A heavy fog had descended upon us , and we realized that finding the other two divers had to be the immediate priority .
She did n't realise that many normal , rational modern women react likewise .
A BT spokesman said : ` People will soon realise that there is no such thing as a free anything in the world , least of all telephone calls . "
But we realise the heavy work that lies ahead , both at home and abroad .
` Maybe by tomorrow you 'll come to realise the folly of your actions , especially if you find you 've no job to go back to . "
` But it is just as common and we intend to make everyone realise it " .
And as soon as conditions permitted , the class would come to realize it .
The brain is so good at filling in , that although most of the time the bulk of our image is blurred and lacks detail and colour , we do not realise it .
